record.text: Bluesky qui utilise Grok pour ban des gens

CGはジェームスとエドワードの車体差の点では原作に近い。実機はジェームスが動輪径を無視しても15.2+1.0(先輪径の単純な目安)として約16.2m程度の全長になるから、エドワードの14.75mより1.45ｍ大きくなる。これにジェームス特有の動輪径を考慮すると車体重量もそこそこ重くなるし車高も高くなる。でも多分CGジェームスとCGエドワードの差よりは若干数cm少なくなると思う、多分。それでも模型期みたくほとんど同じではなく、明らかにジェームスの方が大きい機関車とわかる程度には差がある。
これがいざ描くとなると無からの具現化なので手間がかかった。でもめちゃくちゃ楽しかった。

だから車体比較を徹底して、身長や体格の差を出す時に明確な基準を設け忠実にイメージを再現できるようにした。だから模型期かCG期か区別しないとならなかった。原作はしいて言うならモデルになった実機の寸法になるんだろうから、今描いてるような体格差にはならない。
ゴードンとヘンリーならまだしもジェームスとエドワードの体格差を決める時「よーしもう後には戻れないぞ☆」と腹を決めた。この二台の体格差はCG特有なので。あるいは原作もそうなんだけど、原作は挿絵がまちまちだから証拠がないのよね。証拠があることが忠実さの証でモチベーションになるの。自分の意欲として。

私がTTTE二次創作で目指したものは、人間の姿でもそれが誰なのか一発でわかるようなビジュアルにすることだった。今もそうだけどかなり初期からそれを目標にしてきた。少なくともTTTEを知っている人の目から見て一目でこの人間はあの機関車だとわかる容姿を目指した。ゆえにエドワードは女性でも必ずエドワードだとわからなくてはならず、全キャラクター中最も高難度で大変な面もあったけど描き甲斐もあった。強気なことを言うなら、誰にも真似できない表現を目指したということになるのかな。
それをGrokに「できるかい？」と委ねてみた。
私のオーダーの仕方がうまくないだけなのかもな～(笑)
できてない～

Xiaomi Launched MiMo-Audio, A 7B Speech Language Mannequin Educated On 100M+ Hours With Excessive-Constancy Discrete Tokens

Xiaomi’s MiMo workforce launched MiMo-Audio, a 7-billion-parameter audio-language mannequin that runs a single next-token goal over interleaved textual content and…

external.description: Xiaomi’s MiMo workforce launched MiMo-Audio, a 7-billion-parameter audio-language mannequin that runs a single next-token goal over interleaved textual content and discretized speech, scaling pretraining past 100 million hours of audio. What’s truly new? As a substitute of counting on task-specific heads or lossy acoustic tokens, MiMo-Audio makes use of a bespoke RVQ (residual vector quantization) tokenizer that targets each semantic constancy and high-quality reconstruction. The tokenizer runs at 25 Hz and outputs 8 RVQ layers (≈200 tokens/s), giving the LM entry to “lossless” speech options it will possibly mannequin autoregressively alongside textual content.
external.title: Xiaomi Launched MiMo-Audio, A 7B Speech Language Mannequin Educated On 100M+ Hours With Excessive-Constancy Discrete Tokens

RoboFalcon2.0 Might be One of the First Robotic Birds That Actually Flies Like the Real Thing

A team of engineers from Northwestern Polytechnical University in China have captured the beauty of a falcon soaring through the air, wings beating with precision, lifting off the ground in a burst of…

external.description: A team of engineers from Northwestern Polytechnical University in China have captured the beauty of a falcon soaring through the air, wings beating with precision, lifting off the ground in a burst of power, in a machine called RoboFalcon2.0. Birds and bats have inspired engineers for ages, but replicating flight has been tough. The challenge is the intricate “flap-sweep-fold” motion – known as FSF – that vertebrates use during takeoff and slow-speed flight.

The challenge is the intricate “flap-sweep-fold” motion – known as FSF – that vertebrates use during takeoff and slow-speed flight.
external.title: RoboFalcon2.0 Might be One of the First Robotic Birds That Actually Flies Like the Real Thing

record.text:
Xiaomi Released MiMo-Audio, a 7B Speech Language Model Trained on 100M+ Hours with High-Fidelity Discrete Tokens

Xiaomi’s MiMo team released MiMo-Audio, a 7-billion-parameter audio-language model that runs a single next-token objective over interleaved text and discretized speech, scaling…

external.description: Xiaomi’s MiMo team released MiMo-Audio, a 7-billion-parameter audio-language model that runs a single next-token objective over interleaved text and discretized speech, scaling pretraining beyond 100 million hours of audio. What’s actually new? Instead of relying on task-specific heads or lossy acoustic tokens, MiMo-Audio uses a bespoke RVQ (residual vector quantization) tokenizer that targets both semantic fidelity and high-quality reconstruction. The tokenizer runs at 25 Hz and outputs 8 RVQ layers (≈200 tokens/s), giving the LM access to “lossless” speech features it can model autoregressively alongside text.
external.title: Xiaomi Released MiMo-Audio, a 7B Speech Language Model Trained on 100M+ Hours with High-Fidelity Discrete Tokens

Report: OpenAI Partners with Apple Supplier Luxshare to Build a Pocket-Size AI Device

OpenAI has struck a deal with Luxshare Precision, a key Apple manufacturing partner, to co-develop a new consumer AI device that is currently in the prototype stage, the Information reported on Friday. The device…

external.description: OpenAI has struck a deal with Luxshare Precision, a key Apple manufacturing partner, to co-develop a new consumer AI device that is currently in the prototype stage, the Information reported on Friday. The device is described as pocket-sized and context-aware, designed to work deeply with OpenAI’s large language models. Neither OpenAI nor Luxshare has commented. The move signals OpenAI’s most aggressive push yet into hardware and could challenge the central role of smartphones in everyday computing.
external.title: Report: OpenAI Partners with Apple Supplier Luxshare to Build a Pocket-Size AI Device

Réservée jusqu’ici aux membres du programme Insider, la fonction est désormais disponible sur PC et arrivera dans l’application Xbox sur mobile en octobre. record.text: #Flashinfos #Infos #PC Un RPG gratuit en monde ouvert impressionne les joueurs : « Pourquoi personne n’en parle ? »

external.description:
Un nouveau jeu de rôle attire l’attention grâce à ses graphismes somptueux et à un récit profondément ancré dans l’histoire chinoise. Where Winds Meet sortira le 14 novembre 2025 en free-to-play. Attendu sur Steam et PlayStation 5, il promet un univers immersif, riche en mystères et en découvertes.   Situé dans une période décrite comme un mélange de « chaos, de beauté et de destin », le jeu met en scène un héros en quête de sa véritable identité. external.description:
Ambiente de hondo patriotismo se respiro este 30 de julio en la Habana ,donde se conmemoro el aniversario 68 del asesinato de Frank Pais Garcia y su compañero Raul Pujol Arencibia , asesinados por por esbirros de la tiranía batistiana, cuando entregaban lo mejor de su juventud a la causa de la Revolución,donde se le rindió tributo a los mártires de la Revolución Cubana.

En el otrora Buro de Investigaciones de la Policía Nacional de la dictadura batistiana en las calles 23 y 30 en el capitalino municipio de Plaza de la Revolucion donde jóvenes revolucionarios fueron torturados y asesinados,hoy convertido en el Parque de los Martires de la Clandestinidad ,se realizo un acto político cultural presidido por el miembro del Comite Central Livan Izquierdo Alonso,primer secretario del Partido en la Habana,y Raul Alejandro Palmero Fernández,primer secretario de la UJC en la capital.

Previo al acto una representación de las nuevas generaciones lanzaron ofrendas florales en la zona del Malecón ubicada en la proximidades del Torreón de la Chorrera, antigua sede del Servicio de Inteligencia Naval de la dictadura batistiana, donde fueron torturados y desaparecidos el Líder del Sindicato de los Trabajadores del Transporte José María Pérez Capote,y las combatientes del Movimiento 26 de Julio Lidia Doce y Clodomira Acosta.

Jóvenes,trabajadores, combatientes de la Revolucion Cubana,y familiares de los mártires de la Revolucion,portaron fotografías de los combatientes revolucionarios asesinados por la dictadura batistiana.

En la ocasión recibieron el carnet de militantes del Partido Comunista de Cuba 6 compañeros , y 15 de la Unión de Jóvenes Comunistas .

Las palabras centrales del acto en la Habana por el Dia de los Martires de la Revolucion,fueron pronunciadas por Raul Alejandro Palmero Fernández,primer secretario de la UJC en la ciudad,quien reafirmo que Los jóvenes de hoy serán continuadores de aquella generación que derramo su sangre y ofrendaron sus vidas por un ideal.

record.text: La tecnología avanza a gran velocidad y cada día se integra más a la vida cotidiana. Ahora, el navegador Microsoft Edge incorpora una novedad que puede cambiar la manera en que usamos internet: se trata del “Copilot Mode”, una función basada en inteligencia artificial (IA) que convierte la…

external.description:
La tecnología avanza a gran velocidad y cada día se integra más a la vida cotidiana. Ahora, el navegador Microsoft Edge incorpora una novedad que puede cambiar la manera en que usamos internet: se trata del “Copilot Mode”, una función basada en inteligencia artificial (IA) que convierte la navegación en una experiencia más simple y organizada.

Imagen generada con AI. ©️ Blog Futuro mi Cuba

¿Qué es Copilot Mode?

Podemos imaginarlo como tener un asistente digital dentro del propio navegador. No es un programa aparte ni algo complicado: está ahí, en la misma pantalla donde buscamos, leemos o comparamos.

Cuando lo activamos, aparece un espacio en el que podemos chatear con la IA para pedirle ayuda. Su misión es clara: ahorrar tiempo y hacernos la vida más fácil mientras navegamos.

¿Cómo puede ayudarnos?

Copilot Mode no es ciencia ficción, sino una herramienta práctica para el día a día. Algunas de sus funciones más útiles son:

1. Resumir información
¿Un artículo muy largo o una receta con demasiados pasos? Con un clic, Copilot puede mostrar lo esencial: los puntos principales, los ingredientes o las ideas clave.

2. Comparar precios y productos
Cuando abrimos muchas pestañas para buscar hoteles, vuelos o tiendas, la IA puede organizar esos datos y ayudarnos a encontrar la mejor opción sin perdernos entre tanta información.

3. Automatizar tareas cotidianas
Puede redactar un mensaje, armar una lista de compras o incluso facilitar la reserva de servicios en páginas como Booking o Kayak.

4. Hablar en lugar de escribir
Para quienes prefieren usar la voz en vez del teclado, Copilot responde también mediante comandos hablados.

¿Y la privacidad?

Microsoft aclara que la IA no actúa sola ni invade la privacidad del usuario:

Solo accede a lo que está en las pestañas abiertas si el usuario se lo permite.

Acciones sensibles como compras o reservas siguen necesitando confirmación manual.

Al ser una función experimental, aún se encuentra en fase de ajustes y mejoras.

¿Por qué es importante?

En un mundo donde cada minuto cuenta, Copilot Mode puede ser especialmente útil:

Ayuda a organizar el exceso de información que encontramos en internet.

Es una herramienta accesible para personas con menos experiencia digital, porque guía el proceso paso a paso.

Representa un avance en la forma en que la inteligencia artificial se integra en la vida diaria, no como algo lejano, sino como un apoyo real y cercano.

En resumen

Microsoft Edge con Copilot Mode no solo es un navegador: es un compañero digital dispuesto a simplificar la navegación, organizar nuestras búsquedas y hasta conversar con nosotros para hacer más llevaderas las tareas cotidianas.

Una muestra de cómo la inteligencia artificial, bien aplicada, puede ayudarnos a aprovechar mejor nuestro tiempo y adaptarse a las necesidades de cada persona.

images.alt:
screenshot of dialogue between me and copilot:

me: in statistical rethinking, mcelreath says winnie the pooh goes down the mines of moriah. do the transformers appear before or after this incident in his book?

copilot: In Statistical Rethinking, Richard McElreath uses playful references and metaphors, including Winnie the Pooh and the Mines of Moria, to illustrate statistical concepts. The "Transformers" metaphor (referring to mathematical transformations, not the robots) appears after the Winnie the Pooh/Mines of Moria story. The Pooh story is used in Chapter 2 to introduce grid approximation and Bayesian updating, while the "Transformers" appear later when discussing transformations of variables and distributions, typically in Chapter 3 and beyond.

record.text:
The EU is targeting crypto platforms with the latest Russian sanctions package

The European Union will include cryptocurrency platforms in its latest financial sanctions against Russia, marking digital asset services as targets directly first. The measure, part of the bloc's 19th sanctions…

external.description: The European Union will include cryptocurrency platforms in its latest financial sanctions against Russia, marking digital asset services as targets directly first. The measure, part of the bloc's 19th sanctions package, would ban all cryptocurrency transactions for Russian residents and limit transactions with foreign banks related to Russia's alternative payment systems, according to a European Commission statement released Friday. The package is attempting to block transactions with entities operating in the Russian economic belt.
external.title: The EU is targeting crypto platforms with the latest Russian sanctions package

The package is attempting to block transactions with entities operating in the Russian economic belt.

record.text: Having said that, I find POC, especially UI, it generates in the end very useful. It might be that I’m just more patient and I take time to clean up the mess it creates, or maybe the fact I try to ask only for small iterations of changes and clean as it goes. 😅

I have similar thoughts, however I used Claude only through Copilot on VSC and never for iOS development. I’ve been trying new AI integration in Xcode (ChatGPT, and only free version) lately and if I don’t give it a set of constraints it most often generates garbage code. 🫤
I must admit, that after a tough week, that win makes me enormously happy, and in order not to change that, I decided to go to sleep before I find some new problems 😆

AI is incredible at many things. But it is not yet a good coding assistant. Even if it leads to 20% more code I don't want to use it.

I became a programmer because solving problems makes me feel good. AI makes me feel the opposite. It is like having a mental ball and chain.

Just uninstalled cursor editor & copilot from vscode. #AI does not make me faster or more productive. Without "memory", I have to teach it my preferences over and over again.

It is emotionally taxing and makes me want to avoid coding. At the level AI is operating it just slows me down.
Ban super AI equals stop progress & research. I don't think it's possible.
Aamukahvi juotu eli viikon 6. työpäivä käyntiin. Yksi vertaisarviointi pitäisi saada tänään pakettiin ja ehkä vähän teknistä taistelua väikkäritiedoston kanssa myös luvassa.

Totta, he ovat asiantuntijoita. Ja tässä tapauksessa kun kyse on englannin kielestä, niin hän on natiivi puhuja, minä en, vaikka aikoinaan olen englannin kielen maisterin tutkinnon tehnytkin. Kieltä voi kuitenkin käyttää monella tavalla.
Auts, aika paha tilanne.  Kiitos, tässä urakassa onneksi jo loppusuora käsillä 😊

images.alt:
Statement18 September 2025
On the afternoon of Monday, 15 September, Israeli forces fired upon a clearly identified Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) water truck while it was distributing 10,000 litres of drinking water in the neighbourhood of Sheikh Radwan, in the eastern part of Gaza City, Palestine. The vehicle’s route and schedule had been communicated in advance to the Israeli authorities, as MSF does on a daily basis. 

This attack cannot be dismissed as an error. It was a deliberate attempt to sabotage water distribution to civilians who cannot leave the area, particularly the poorest, the sick, and the most vulnerable living in tents or in the rubble of what used to be their homes.

images.alt:
OpenAI also acknowledged the persistence of the problem in its own systems. The company stated in the paper that “ChatGPT also hallucinates. GPT‑5 has significantly fewer hallucinations, especially when reasoning, but they still occur. Hallucinations remain a fundamental challenge for all large language models.”

OpenAI’s own advanced reasoning models actually hallucinated more frequently than simpler systems. The company’s o1 reasoning model “hallucinated 16 percent of the time” when summarizing public information, while newer models o3 and o4-mini “hallucinated 33 percent and 48 percent of the time, respectively.”

“Unlike human intelligence, it lacks the humility to acknowledge uncertainty,” said Neil Shah, VP for research and partner at Counterpoint Technologies. “When unsure, it doesn’t defer to deeper research or human oversight; instead, it often presents estimates as facts.”

You art is powerful and inspires many. It might never please everybody, even so, don't be stopped, don't be censored.

Post and post and post, I want to see all creativity here.

All of it.

record.text: I must admit I enjoy pitting Claude against ChatGPT. I ask them to write responses and counterarguments to each other’s points in search of a correct answer. Sometimes it works, but most of the time, they’re as sychophantic with each other as they are with me. It’s like watching two Furbys converse.

Debate is a performance and a skill, not some neutral crucible into which two ideas enter and the truth leaves.
A debate between a flat earther and a hollow earther will not yield truth.
A skilled debater could take an obviously false position and argue rings around someone with no debate skills.

value.text: imagine relying on AI to write your bio and then having the nerve to say you're witty and full of personality

images.alt: Anderson felt her bio was authentically her even if it was written by a chatbot. “My bio is 100 percent in alignment with my true personality,” she told me. “I don’t have a filter. I’m very witty. I’m full of personality.” Nor did she think using ChatGPT reflected the “bare minimum energy” she loathed. “It took me an hour and change to drill down my bio to be that good,” she explained. “I had to edit it, edit it, edit it down. I have to keep talking to it.” On the other hand, she admits that ChatGPT has sapped her motivation to write a first draft of anything herself, even though she minored in writing in college and described herself as a “wordsmith.” “I’m gonna be honest with you: Once you use ChatGPT, you don’t want to think for yourself anymore,” she said.

record.text: Estoy en este bluit sobre DanDaDan, no me escondo.

I left Silicon Valley in 2018. Even then the indepedent/non-partisan registered voters were growing faster than the registered Democrats. 

The rise of the religious Nones gets ample reporting. The rise of non-partisan voter Nones, not so much.
It is funny that consevatives fear monger the Democratic party is far left. Imagine thinking Hakeem Jeffries or Chuck Schumer are far left.

Then there is this rare moment of self-awareness that they hate the world, the world hates them back and perhaps that might be a problem. Just a flash. Surprised ChatGPT let this through. 

The 100% we are right about everything op-eds are everywhere.

If a dystopian fiction writer was to have a character say "Once you use ChatGPT, you don't want to think for yourself anymore", people would say that writer was being a bit too on-the-nose and didactic.
